title: Hanabi
tagline: Cooperative solitaire where the only cards you can't see are the ones you can play.
good: An interesting puzzle which requires a combination of logic, luck, and metagaming to overcome.
Properly cooperative gameplay. Every player is important, and free to make their own decisions without input from others.
Tense moments of acting on hunches and incomplete information, and sharing the celebration/commiserations of those moments with others.
bad: The outcome of the game being heavily influenced by chance isn't your cup of tea.
A largely silent game wouldn't suit your group.
An important memory-reliant subgame sounds too annoying.
